alert.note: Alert for Kent (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 3:32PM EDT until June 27 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Delaware...northeast Maryland...and southern New Jersey...including the following counties...in Delaware...Kent and New Castle. In northeast Maryland...Kent and Queen Anne`s. In southern New Jersey...Cumberland and Salem. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 328 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.0 inches are possible across portions of the advised area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Wilmington, Newark, Middletown, Pennsville, Smyrna, Carneys Point, New Castle, Salem, Clayton, Delaware City, Newport, and Millington. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 0 and 12. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 2. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
